posts.author: Johan Sultan
posts.content:
I play on a high level PW. I’m looking for a build that will be able to solo regular and small party content. The character will be used for pvm only.

Levels 41-60 work exactly like levels 21-40.

While levels are high the gear is capped at +5.
No immunity gear on the server.

+12 to all attributes obtained via forge system. Saving throws easily added to gear via forge up to default caps.

I’m thinking DwD with full EDR might be my best bet but open to any suggestions.

Thanks in advance for any help and hope you guys enjoy the build challenge without that pesky lvl 40 cap.


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Greetings and hello Johan Sultan

Thanks for the info
This is an interesting request

In theory my current thoughts are: 
+12 to all attributes favors multi-attribute dependent (or 'MAD') builds such as paladin, monk
Being able to hit the saves cap with items devalues the CoT bonus to saves

In my mind I wonder:
What is the name of the PW, can I find out more details about it?
What types of damage do you mostly face? Is it physical or elemental? Or is it spellcasting related (ie Bigby's/IGMS)
Where do spellcasters, both divine (ie cleric) and arcane (ie wizard/sorc) fit into the picture?
Is Use Magical Device (UMD) useful to cast spells from scrolls/wands and equip items?
How strictly are alignment restrictions enforced? Can you go Bard / DD / PM for example?

You brought up dwarven defender, I suspect for a reason.
Are you looking to tank physical damage against opponents?
Does this mean you face many high physical damage dealing opponents?
Does the dwarven defender damage reduction continue to improve every 4 levels plus a bonus feat after Dwarven Defender 30? 
A fighter 10 DD 30 with EDR III provides damage reduction 30/- (21/- plus 9/-), for example.
A fighter 10 DD 50 would have damage reduction 42/-
But what if you had a Wizard 26 / Paladin 4 / DD 30 who can cast Improved Invisibility/Premonition/Epic Warding, all sorts of buffs, enemies can kill themselves on extended Mestil's Acid Sheath and extended Elemental Shields, mind immunity from Mind Blank, death magic & negative energy immunity from Shadow Shield etc etc and you can cast Bigby's to disable opponents, Mords to remove enemy buffs, ILMS/IGMS spam (ie ILMS + still ILMS + IGMS + still IGMS + empowered IGMS + maximize IGMS to fill 4  5 6 7 8 and 9) etc etc plus you have disease/fear immunity and great saves, maybe divine might

Anyway some ideas for you to think about maybe the best way to approach this is to keep discussing what you are looking for until we get the answer you seek
Perhaps there are others who have experience playing lvl 60 builds

posts.author: Johan Sultan
posts.content:
the name of the PW is A Carpatihian Nightmare.
Some more info about the server as requested....

Dev Crit is unchanged and allowed.
Gear has strict lvl requirements. As you lvl up you visit the forge to upgrade your +1 to +2 and so on. Max of 8 properties per item. You basically buy basic gear and upgrade as you level up. My 40+ chars are using the same items i bought at lvl 1 just upgraded with 8 properties on each. They do a great job of keeping your character balanced for the content intended for your level range.  

I am currently using Andariel build by Valerfor. I am lvl 45 and end game mobs have no trouble hitting my 75 ac.
Enemy mobs are a mix of physical and magic users. You have to be prepared for both. This can be a challenge with no immunity gear on the server.

Pale masters are not allowed to select epic mage armor.

Epic Dragon Knight and Mummy dust have been buffed to be powerful summons.

Alignment changes are allowed and can be done anytime with simple keyboard commands.

RDD is very good because of fire immunity. Lots of fire based damage resulting in your character looking like burnt toast after some encounters.

The strongest character I have teamed up with so far said his build was Druid/monk/DwD. He was plowing through mobs in elemental or dragon form while i was constantly using invis pots to hide and  heal up.

Heal pots and kits have been nerfed to heal a max of 150 damage each use. Your 1k hp seems awesome until you drink a potion of Heal and it barely moves up your health bar. You are forced to heal early and often.

Npc wand crafter will make wands with any spell up to lvl 4. I carry keen edge and improved invis wands around. 

Overall I am loving the server and it is the most balanced and challenging PW I have found. I seen lvl 60 server and assumed high magic broken characters. I could not have been more wrong. An item with only Haste has a lvl req of 9. No passing good gear down to fresh alts because of the level reqs. Early levels you are not trying to finish a zone for quick levels you are trying to just survive until you get that level for a chance to upgrade gear.

I have a pet project of Bard/rdd/dwd since you are allowed simple alignment changes. I am lvl 40 on that character and it has potential but the build is very rough and unrefined. I am surviving content just have lower ab than expected.

Thanks for the reply and I will gladly share any more needed information.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Johan for your message some very useful information here

It sounds like:
- end game enemies have high AB (if they have no trouble hitting 75 AC), although you can confirm that by checking the combat log exactly how much AB they have (I'm guessing 65-70+?) -> therefore damage reduction (ie DD) and concealment (ie improved invisibility 50%) are good
- alignment changes are easy and allowed
- dev crit is unchanged and allowed
- lots of fire damage
- great access to magic wands
- you are already thinking about Bard / RDD / DD

Bard / RDD / DD is an excellent idea in fact, they are three very powerful classes that will synergise well together.
I would make such a build but it is not allowed or difficult in many environments. 

Bard has Bard Song / Curse Song which in your +5 environment, could provide effective +7 AB/AC at level 16, +8 AB/AC at level 25 and +9 AB/AC at level 30, lots of skills. Lasting inspiration can be obtained with level 20 to make the song last a long time
RDD provides AC / HP / great immunities as mentioned, stat boosts, and has Epic Prowess / Epic Damage Reduction as bonus feats
Dwarven Defenders have great HP, immunity to sneak from flanking, dexterity AC protection, get Epic Prowess / Epic Weapon Focus / Overwhelming Critical / Devastating Critical / Epic Energy Resistance / Epic Damage Reduction as bonus feats.

I did write a Dwarven Draconic Attacker (Sorc RDD DD) with dev crit, AB 44 at 40 but I feel we can create something more focused to your level 60 goal which suits your needs better to try to incorporate dev crit, decent AB, EDR III / high damage resistance. 
In terms of the source of AB, I take it strength is what you are pursuing rather than dexterity.

I think perhaps a Bard 20 / Dwarven Defender 30 / RDD 10 split might be good here? Aiming for Bard/Curse Song 16, EDR III, Dev Crit, UMD, Tumble, Lasting Inspiration, Blind Fight/Improved Knockdown?
Bard 20 / DD 26 / RDD 14 might be ok too for some late spot and search skill dumps as well. Just depends on how much DR you want and whether those skill dumps would be helpful for you.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I would suggest opting for more than Bard20 so that you can get Lasting Inspiration early in the build and still have Bard levels left for skill dumps. Bard24/RDD10/DD26 loses 3/- DR but it is undispellable (assuming vanilla dispel) and has room for skill dumps after LI. It's tempting to go for more Bard levels to improve Bard Song but Bard32/RDD10/DD18 loses 9/- DR compared to a Bard20/RDD10/DD30, and going for less Bard levels results in a non-optimal class spread.

If you're going for a Bard/RDD/DD then Bard20/RDD10/DD30, Bard24/RDD10/DD26, or Bard32/RDD10/DD18 are the class spreads I would recommend. In all three cases I would go with a pre-epic spread of Bard6/RDD4/DD10, then go for RDD9 by level 25 in order to get the most skill points.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
For comparison a minmaxed STR Figh11/WM49 would have +86 AB with +12 STR and a +5 EB weapon, +101 AB at the AB cap. It would have a 63 DC Dev Crit which matches the 63 DC that your build achieves. Unless there are changes to spell DCs a maxed Implosion would reach 50 DC, so the Dev Crit DC is far beyond what any caster can hope to achieve.

I tested a Bard32/RDD10/DD18, in comparison to your Bard12/RDD10/DD38 it loses 3-4 AB and 15/- DR but gains a level 30 Bard/Curse Song (which requires +18 Perform from gear). For a hack-and-slash build the Bard12/RDD10/DD38 is probably the better choice.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Bard/DD/RDD is what I would suggest as well.

Logic says that if the end-game mobs are having way high AB then your PW is geared towards resistances & DD offers tons of that. Furthermore, if you wanted to enhance the "invulnerable" aspect of your hero then you could change some epic feats for another elemental resistance, other than fire of course, just like "the resistor" did back then (Legacy ECB Archives). Say, for example, Fire & Acid is the most prevalent source of dmg at high-levels, then you will be immune to fire from RDD & then maybe 40 resist on Acid along with 30+ physical resistance from DD, I think they will bond well together. If the other source of dmg is magical or somesuch, ignore this & continue raising your Str.

Btw, Andariel has a max 84AC on +5 PW (As a level 40 Char).
10 (base) +1 (dex) +11 (Plate & Shield) +8 (Tumble) +5 (Rdd) +12 (PM) +5 (EMA) +1 (MA) +25 (Items) +4 (Haste) +2 (AS, if taken) = 84AC.
As a level 60 build (Bard 12/  RDD 10/ Pale Master 38) it goes as high as 97AC (+8 PM, -1 RDD, +2 Song, +4 Tumble) alongside 40/- Acid resist, 20/- Cold? resist & 1900 Epic Warding Shield. 

Less offensive than the Bard/DD/RDD combo though.

Anyway, happy gaming & keep us informed on how your journey goes!
